scan_table_check.description: Code must not depend on data. This is a fundemantal architectural guard rail. The ServiceNow platform had not been designed with this constraint in mind in the beginning. More and more capabilities have been added that allow for a clear distinction between code and data. User Criteria however is one of the examples where this distinction is not well-supported. User Criteria by design allow code to depend on data (groups, users, companies, etc.) and this should, of course, be avoided. See chapter "Data vs. Code" in the whitepaper "A mature development and deployment process" for further details.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - User Criteria depends on data
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Remove all references to users, groups, companies, departments and locations. Use one of the following alternatives: 1. Use roles and/or a scripted condition that determines the eligible part of the organization dynamically based on configuration. 2. Deploy the User Criteria WITHOUT references to data and use Business Rules or Scheduled Jobs to populate these references dynamically post deployment. 3. Treat User Criteria as data and allow specific users on the production environment to manage and maintain User Criteria as if it was production data - make sure however that these user-generated User Critera are always associated to the global scope.
scan_table_check.short_description: A User Criteria must not depend on data
